creator: forevertraveller@hotmail.com
text:
In the attached XSL-FO, the table has three columns whose widths are all set 
to 1in. And I set the property width of the cell which is located in the first 
row and the second column to 2in. However the produced PDF shows that the 
widths of the three columns are still equal and the property "width" on cell 
does not take effect.

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
FOP doesn't support getting column widths from the first table row as 
described in http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/tables.html#width-layout, yet. Even the 
current development code doesn't do that, yet.

As a work-around you'll have to specify the column widths directly on the 
table-column nodes instead.

I'll leave the bug open as a reminder to implement that in FOP trunk.
*** Bug 38777 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
